text:
what's up everybody for the Vagabrothers
 and these are top 10 tips on
what to do in Lapland Finland in the summer.
Lapland is way up in the Arctic Circle which makes it special place to visit anytime
but especially in summer.
So here are our tips on how to make the most
of your time under the Midnight Sun
Number one get lost in Nature.
Lapland is all about unspoiled nature. It takes up  about a 1/3 of Finland
It's least populated region in the least populated country in the EU

get lost in natural places like Lemmenjoki
National Park and you won't see another
soul for hours

Number two; reindeer there are so many
reindeer in Lapland

that there's literally more reindoor
think cars
It's the reindeer that brought the Sami people here over 10,000 years ago
Number three meet the Sami
Lapland is home to the Sami
the last indigenous people of Europe who've lived here for over ten thousand years

as a nomadic reindeer herders and
fishermen surviving arctic winters

as cold as -40 Celsius. learn
more about the culture with the crash course
at the Siida Cultural Center in Inari
Number Four Lake Inari

spend some time on Lake Inari either on
lake side cottage

or take a cruise to Ukkos Island a holy
place for the Sami
Number five salmon fishing

don't spend all your time on the lake
make sure you go fishing

in Lapland's rivers the Tenojoki
has some the best salmon fishing
in all of Europe and if you're lucky
you can hook a big one.
Number Six Every Man's Right

Finland has a law called every man's right 
which allows anyone to
camp or forage anywhere in Finland (public land)
So if you're on a tight budget you can pull over and finding dinner
a just make sure those mushrooms aren't poisonous.
Number seven cloud berries
If you're there in July make sure you eat some cloud berries
the super tasty Finnish berry that has lots more vitamin C

than an orange but they only bloom for
three weeks so if you see them munch them quick
Number Eight Fast Food
Finland has some funky food

you're not going to find anywhere else
like bear pizza and reindeer kebab
Number nine Sami Music
Few people realize but the Sami are
are one of the most musically talented
indigenous communities on earth.
watch modern day rappers and rockers
compete against their global counterparts each August at the Indigenous Music Festival in Inari
Number Ten the Midnight Sun
Take advantage of the Midnight Sun
which doesn't set for two whole months. It might mess up your sleep pattern
but it gives a new definition to seizing the day because hey

let's be honest how often are you in the
Arctic Circle

so those are our tips to having fun in the
Arctic in the summer.
What are yours?
If you've been to Lapland or you're from there

share your tips to the comment box below
and if you haven't seen our video from Lapland
stay tuned it's on right after this

As always if you enjoyed the video give it
a thumbs up share with your friends to

help us grow this project and subscribe
to our channel for new travel videos
every Tuesday.
